clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: Their boss made a fair decision that they could both respect.
sentences.chinese: 老板做了一个公平决定，他们都心服口服。

sentences.english: Which would make Barcelona's lopsided win even more impressive.
sentences.chinese: 巴塞罗那一边倒的胜利是令人心服口服的。

sentences.english: Original gowardesh just watch frightened chicken monkey, and thus take orally.
sentences.chinese: 原来狗娃只是“吓鸡儆猴”，众人由此心服口服。

sentences.english: You can buy a man with gold, but only blood and steel will keep him true.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用钱买通，但只有铁血才能让他心服口服。

sentences.english: The problem was the Truth was so convincing how could anyone not be persuaded by it.
sentences.chinese: 问题是真理令人心服口服，谁不能被它说服呢。

definition: to submit cheerfully/to accept willingly (idiom)
to accept wholeheartedly/to embrace/to be won over
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
to have nothing to say (idiom)
to be convinced/to accept
to have faith in/to believe in/to have confidence in/to respect
to have a whole new level of respect for sb or sth/to sit up and take notice (of sb's improved performance etc)
to treat sb favorably/to view in a new light
deference/esteem/to admire
to consider oneself as being not as good as the others
to feel ashamed at being inferior (idiom)
lit. for one's face to reach rock bottom/to be thoroughly discredited (idiom)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to bow before (idiom)/to capitulate
to concede/to admit defeat
to prostrate oneself in admiration (idiom); to adulate sb
